newsitem.title: USA: Speaker Gingrich "deeply committed" to lower taxes.
newsitem.headline: Speaker Gingrich "deeply committed" to lower taxes.

text.p: House Speaker Newt Gingrich said Friday he was "deeply committed" to lower taxes and would like to eliminate capital gains and death taxes.
Gingrich, speaking to the House, said he would like to eliminate capital gains and death taxes.

"I am deeply committed to lowering taxes," Gingrich said in a speech explaining his position following comments Monday interpreted as saying that he was willing forgo a tax cut in order to ensure a balanced budget.
"I wanted to challenge the liberals -- don't tell me about tax cuts, tell me about the size of government," Gingrich said, declaring he wanted a smaller government.
